question: What should I do if my Alliance account has expired and been deactivated, I will not renew it, but I still need to access my data to move it off the Alliance Federation clusters?
answer: Please send an email to support@tech.alliancecan.ca so that we can assist you with your request.

question: Who should I contact if I can't find the answer to my account renewal question in the FAQ?
answer: Please send an email to renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca so that we can assist you with your request.

question: What happens if an active Alliance account is not renewed by June 10, 2025?
answer: Any active account that is not renewed by June 10, 2025, will expire and be automatically deactivated after that date.

question: Can a deactivated Alliance account be reactivated?
answer: Yes, accounts can be reactivated at any time, even after they have been deactivated.

question: What are the consequences for a faculty member with sponsored users if their Alliance account expires?
answer: If a faculty member with sponsored users allows their account to expire, their account as well as the account of all those users they sponsor will be deactivated. Any job submitted by them or their sponsored users will be paused and their research group will lose access to their files until the sponsor account is reactivated.

question: What happens to jobs submitted by a faculty member or their sponsored users if the faculty member's account expires?
answer: Any job submitted by you or your sponsored users will be paused until the sponsor account is reactivated.

question: What should a faculty member do if their account or their sponsored users' accounts are no longer needed?
answer: If your account or those of your sponsored users are no longer needed, you can let them expire.

question: What steps are involved for a faculty member to renew their Alliance account?
answer: You will receive an email during the account renewal period with a link to the account renewal form on the CCDB. Please update your contact information and your CCV, fill out a short User Satisfaction Survey and update the status of your sponsored roles.

question: Which university faculty members are required to submit or update a Canadian Common CV (CCV) for Alliance account renewal?
answer: All university faculty, including adjunct faculty, are required to submit a Canadian Common CV (CCV) or update an existing one and report publications enabled by Alliance Federation resources to renew their accounts.

question: Who is exempt from the Canadian Common CV (CCV) submission requirement for Alliance account renewal?
answer: Emeritus and retired faculty, as well as Librarians and Non-academic PIs, are exempted from this requirement.

question: What additional task is required of university faculty who sponsor other users during account renewal?
answer: University faculty who have sponsored other users will also be asked to update the status of these accounts (i.e. whether they are continuing or their work is done and the sponsorship has therefore ended).

question: How do faculty members initiate the account renewal request after updating their information and sponsored user statuses?
answer: Once you have updated and confirmed all information and updated the status of your sponsored users, you must click the 'REQUEST ACCOUNT RENEWAL' button on the left side of the account renewals form to initiate the renewal request.

question: For which specific roles is uploading a new Canadian Common CV (CCV) required for Alliance account renewal?
answer: Uploading a new CCV is only required for users with Faculty and Adjunct Faculty roles at Canadian academic institutions.

question: Is submitting a CCV optional for retired faculty, Emeritus professors, and Librarians during Alliance account renewal?
answer: Yes, submitting a CCV is optional for retired faculty, Emeritus professors and Librarians.

question: Who should retired faculty, Emeritus professors, or Librarians contact if they do not wish to submit a CCV for account renewal?
answer: If you fall into one of these three categories and do not wish to submit a CCV, please send an email to renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca.

question: If a Principal Investigator (PI) with a faculty role moves to a different institution, will users sponsored under their old role be automatically transferred to their new role?
answer: No. Any user you want to sponsor with your new faculty role will have to apply for a new role sponsored by your new faculty position.

question: What happens to sponsored users' access to a Resource Allocation Project (RAP) if their PI moves institutions and they were sponsored under the old role?
answer: Users sponsored with your old role will lose access to the Resource Allocation Project (RAP) where your resources are allocated.

question: How can a PI add sponsored users to their Resource Allocation Project (RAP) once their new roles are activated?
answer: You can add to and remove RAP members by going to 'My Projects' → 'Manage Project Membership'.

question: Is uploading a new CCV required for account renewal if one was already updated for a Resource Allocation Competition (RAC) application in the fall?
answer: No. If you have updated your CCV for your RAC application in the fall, uploading a new CCV to renew your account is optional.

question: When is it mandatory to upload a new CCV for Alliance account renewal?
answer: If you have not uploaded a new CCV since the last renewal of your account, you will have to upload a new one.

question: If an updated CCV is already on file but a user chooses to upload a new one during account renewal, what specific information needs to be marked?
answer: You will only have to mark any new publication enabled by the use of the Alliance Federation resources and not all the publications on your CCV.

question: Can a sponsor access the files of a sponsored user who has moved on and is no longer under their sponsorship?
answer: Consent from that user may be required for you to access the files you want. If you need access to such files, it is important to make arrangements with your sponsored user as soon as possible.

question: What are the steps for a user with a sponsored role (e.g., Doctoral, Masters, External Collaborator) to renew their account?
answer: You will receive an email during the account renewal period directing you to the account renewal form. Please update your contact information, complete the form and fill out a short 'User Satisfaction Survey'. Once you have updated and confirmed all information, you must click the REQUEST ACCOUNT RENEWAL button on the left side of the account renewals form to initiate the renewal request.

question: What happens after a sponsored user initiates their renewal request if their sponsor has marked them as continuing?
answer: Once done, your account will be renewed immediately or as soon as your sponsor renews their own account.

question: What should a sponsored user do if their sponsor indicates they have moved on, graduated, or changed positions?
answer: If your sponsor has indicated that you have moved on, graduated, or changed positions, you will not be able to renew that particular role. Instead, you must apply for a new role that reflects your actual circumstances.

question: Why might a sponsored role remain deactivated even after the sponsored user completes their account renewal on CCDB?
answer: If you completed the renewal of your account on CCDB but your role(s) still show as deactivated, that's because your sponsor has not yet renewed / reactivated their account.

question: When will a sponsored user's role be activated after they renew their account?
answer: Your role should be activated as soon as your sponsor renews their account and confirms your role.

question: Whom should a sponsored user contact if they have questions or need help regarding their account renewal process?
answer: If you have any questions or need help, please email renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca.

question: What should a sponsored user do if they made a mistake and renewed their account with the wrong role?
answer: You should create a new role with your current information and update your account with the new role. Just log into CCDB and in the main menu, under 'My Account', go to 'Apply for a new role'. Follow the instructions and select your new role.

question: What happens to an old sponsored role if a new one is created and the old one is not renewed?
answer: Your old role will automatically expire and be deactivated on the morning of June 11, 2025 if it is not renewed.

question: How can a user add multiple roles to their Alliance account?
answer: If you want to have several roles, add a new role by going to https://ccdb.alliancecan.ca/me/add_role and click on “disable old roles” on that page.

question: If a user has several roles, can they set more than one as their primary role?
answer: No, it is possible to submit several applications, but you can only set one of them as your primary role.

question: Who should a sponsored user contact if they are trying to reactivate an old sponsored role but their sponsor cannot confirm it?
answer: Please send an email to renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca so that we can assist you with your request.
